javax.time.calendrical

Interface Temporal.WithAdjuster

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ChronoLocalDate<C>, ChronoLocalDateTime<C>, Era<C>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DayOfWeek, Instant, LocalDate, LocalDateTime, LocalTime, Month, MonthDay, OffsetDate, OffsetDateTime, OffsetTime, Year, YearMonth, ZoneOffset
    Enclosing interface:
    Temporal

    public static interface Temporal.WithAdjuster
    Strategy for adjusting a temporal object.

    This interface allows different kinds of adjustment to be modeled. Examples might be an adjuster that sets the date avoiding weekends, or one that sets the date to the last day of the month.

    Implementations should not normally be used directly. Instead, the Temporal.with(WithAdjuster) method should be used: 

       dateTime = dateTime.with(adjuster);

    See Adjusters for a standard set of adjusters, including finding the last day of the month.

    Implementation notes

    This interface must be implemented with care to ensure other classes operate correctly. All implementations that can be instantiated must be final, immutable and thread-safe.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Temporal doWithAdjustment(Temporal temporal)
      Implementation of the strategy to make an adjustment to the specified temporal object.

    • Method Detail

      • doWithAdjustment

        Temporal doWithAdjustment(Temporal temporal)
        Implementation of the strategy to make an adjustment to the specified temporal object.

        This method is not intended to be called by application code directly. Instead, the Temporal.with(WithAdjuster) method should be used: 

           dateTime = dateTime.with(adjuster);
        Implementation notes
        The implementation takes the input object and adjusts it according to an algorithm. For example, it could be used to adjust a date to "next Wednesday".

        Implementations must use the methods on Temporal to make the adjustment. The returned object must have the same observable type as the input.

        The target object must not be altered by this method. Instead, an adjusted copy of the original must be returned. This provides equivalent, safe behavior for immutable and mutable implementations.

        This interface can be used by calendar systems other than ISO. Implementations may choose to document compatibility with other calendar systems, or validate for it by querying the chronology from the input object.

        Parameters:
        temporal - the temporal object to adjust, not null
        Returns:
        an object of the same type with the adjustment made, not null
        Throws:
        DateTimeException - if unable to make the adjustment
        ArithmeticException - if numeric overflow occurs
